pageContext.description: Socket a good deal cracked near mouth on both sides. Edge of socket has been filed away for a portion measuring 18mm. Point is broken.
pageContext.patina: All the patina has been cleaned off.
pageContext.publications: Geo. Rollerton in a letter to Major Bunny, dated 16.12.1873 (From Anatomical Dept. Mus. Oxford) Asks permission to describe them in a short paper for the Newbury Field Club.,Evans, J. Anc. Bronze Implements, 330, 333,Arch Ass. Journ. SVI, pl. XXVI, S.,Ibid. XVI, 250,V.C.H. Berks, i. 195,Hist of Newbury and Environs, 142, fig.,Trans. Newbury Dist. Field Club, ii. 124-5.
pageContext.collection: Lt. Col. E. J. St. John, Shinfold
pageContext.site: England,Berkshire,Speen,"(In the Speen Moor, Valley of the Kennet, in the peat)",1825
pageContext.remarks: "Professor Rollerton of Oxford pronounces them to have undoubtedly belonged to the Ancient Britons."
